bibl.title: English translation [from Spanish] of letter from Maria Teresa Rojas to Philip Showalter Hench, September 18, 1952

div1.p: Rojas describes her travels in Europe and refers to correspondence between Hench and Nogueira.

div1.head: English translation [from Spanish] of letter from Maria Teresa Rojas to Philip Showalter Hench, September 18, 1952 (See Spanish original.)
div1.p:
I wrote you from Vienna, a long letter which I doubt that you
received because of the Russian censor. I told you about our
trip, which was a little rushed because we were attending the
Meeting of Americanists in Cambridge and of “Ethnografia” (?)
in Vienna, accompanying Fernando Ortiz who was the official
representative from Cuba.

Before leaving Havana I received a copy of the letter sent by
you to Dr. Nogueira and now they tell me that they have received
a long letter from you.

We are resting for a few days at this beautiful Italian lake af-
ter a month of quite intense touring, but if you have something
interesting that you wish to tell me you can write me at the
hotel Meurice, Rue de Rivoli in Paris to which we shall return
in a few days and where we shall remain until November 6th; we
have our return passage on the Queen Elizabeth. Would you, by
chance, be in New York at that time? I would like very much to
see you again before my return to Cuba. How is Mrs. Hench? Tell
her that we always remember her in Paris. A cordial greeting to
both of you.
